summary: A personal and confidential letter from attorney David G. Liston to an individual named 'Black', sent via Federal Express. The letter states that Liston's firm has been retained by an unnamed female client to investigate her prior interactions with Black and requests copies of any written agreements between Black and the client.

persons.name: David G. Liston
persons.context: Author of the letter, representing an unnamed female client in an investigation into her prior interactions with the recipient, Mr. Black.

persons.name: Black
persons.context: The individual to whom the letter is addressed, regarding prior interactions with an unnamed female client who has retained David Liston's firm.

connections.description: Liston, as an attorney, is formally corresponding with Black on behalf of an unnamed client regarding an investigation into the client's prior interactions with Black.

events.title: Previous letter sent to Black
events.description: David Liston's firm sent a prior letter to Black, referenced as an enclosure to this document.

events.title: Deadline for response
events.description: The deadline set by David Liston for Black or his counsel to respond to the request for copies of written agreements.

locations: The Chrysler Building, 405 Lexington Avenue, 46th Floor, New York, New York 10174
keyFacts: An unnamed female client has retained attorney David Liston's firm to investigate her prior interactions with an individual named Black.
The letter is a formal request for Black to provide copies of any written agreements between himself and the unnamed client.
The correspondence is marked 'PERSONAL AND CONFIDENTIAL' and was sent via Federal Express.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting a potential connection to the broader investigation, though the specific parties and subject are not detailed in this excerpt.
